purpose: Duration formatting with adaptive modes, multiple style presets, and humanize function for natural language descriptions
quickStart:
import { Duration, humanize } from '@epdoc/duration';

console.log(new Duration.Formatter().narrow.format(3661000)); // '1h01m01s'
console.log(humanize(3661000)); // 'about an hour'
console.log(humanize(-3661000, true)); // 'about an hour ago'
keyExports: Duration namespace — Duration.Formatter class with fluent builder API
humanize(ms, future?) — natural language duration description
Time namespace — time constant values (ms per second, minute, hour, etc.)
supportedLocales — list of supported locale strings

keyPatterns.name: Fluent formatter
keyPatterns.description: Chain style presets (.narrow, .digital, .long, .short) and options (.adaptive(n), fractionalDigits(n)) on Duration.Formatter before calling .format(ms)

keyPatterns.name: Humanize
keyPatterns.description: humanize(ms) returns a locale-sensitive natural language string; pass true as second arg to include future tense prefix

architecture.flow: consts.ts (Time) + duration/format.ts + duration/i18n.ts + duration/mod.ts (Formatter) + humanize/mod.ts → mod.ts
architecture.keyDesign: Builds on Intl.DurationFormat with adaptive significant-unit selection and humanize mode not available in the standard API
